org.block.project.block

Interface Block.ParameterInsertBlock

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Block
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNumberOperation, SumOperation
    Enclosing interface:
    Block

    public static interface Block.ParameterInsertBlock
extends Block
    If a Block requires more data that can be provided in a programmable way, then the Block should implement ParameterInsertBlock which is a standard method of Parameters. This isn't descriptive as there is a issue which removes this and replaces it with something else. The main issue with this implementation is that it assumes that all parameters can be accepted but doesn't let all parameters to be accepted, resulting in a lot of errors.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.block.project.block.Block

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxCount

        int getMaxCount()
        Gets the max amount of parameters that the Block can accept. This can be 0. If you wish to have unlimited, do Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Returns:
        The max amount of parameters that the Block can accept

      • getCurrentParameters

        java.util.List<Block.ValueBlock<?>> getCurrentParameters()
        Gets all the parameters the user has currently linked to the Block. This also includes hovering Blocks (where the user is dragging an item which has hovered over this block and the program is suggesting the attachment).
        Returns:
        A ordered unmodifiable list of all parameters currently linked

      • addParameter

        void addParameter(Block.ValueBlock<?> block)
        Adds the parameter to the next free slot. Please note that the parameter is not shown until the panel is repainted.
        Parameters:
        block - The block you wish to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter you have given cannot be added to the slot then this will be thrown

      • addParameter

        void addParameter(int index,
                  Block.ValueBlock<?> block)
        Adds the parameter to the index value set, this will override the current block in its slot if there is one. Please note that the parameter is not shown until the panel is repainted.
        Parameters:
        index - The position to add to
        block - The block to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter you have given cannot be added to the slot then this will be thrown

      • removeParameter

        void removeParameter(Block.ValueBlock<?> block)
        Removes the provided parameter from the list of parameters. Please note that the parameter will continue to show until the panel is repainted
        Parameters:
        block - The block to remove

      • removeParameter

        void removeParameter(int space)
        Removes the parameter in the provided slot Please note that the parameter will continue to show until the panel is repainted
        Parameters:
        space - The slot you wish to remove

      • canAccept

        boolean canAccept(int slot,
                  Block.ValueBlock<?> block)
        Checks if the provided block can be accepted within the provided slot. This is useful for if you need one parameter to be Boolean and the other to be Integer
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot to check
        block - The block to check
        Returns:
        if the provided block can be accepted within the provided slot.

      • moveParameter

        default void moveParameter(Block.ValueBlock<?> block,
                           int spaces)
        Moves the provided block down the list.
        Parameters:
        block - The block to move
        spaces - The amount of spaces to move down (this can be a negative number)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the block can not be found
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the block (or a moved block from this block moving) cannot be accepted in its new slot
